result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin K. Ossman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 25% of prison wages; During E.S. - 20% of net wages or $50.00 min. per month.

credit for time served since 8/21/2014
Concurrent with: 2014 CF 202
Due immediately; serve concurrent w/jail sentence.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Calvin K. Ossman in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Defendant Calvin K. Ossman in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have no factual problems with the pre-sentence.  Court reads victim impact statements.  Remarks by Atty. White and Atty. Weerts for joint recommendation.  Court pronounces sentence.  Amortize the costs.  Court signs restitution order.
Sentencing hearing on May 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Calvin K. Ossman in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Defendant Calvin K. Ossman in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews plea questionnaire.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 2.  Remaining count will be dismissed, but read-in.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Court makes its findings and orders a pre-sentence report.
